page.title: 09FORTON VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The village hall in Forton was formerly the old school building but in 1965 when the third and final phase of the new school was completed it was taken over for village activities. The original old school was constructed in 1878 and consisted of 2 classrooms, which could be separated by a partition or opened out as a full hall,and the headmaster's house. Since 1965 it has been used for all sorts of village functions:_dances and discos, concerts,meetings of the Parish Council,Mothers' Union,Over 60's etc, as well as being used for refreshments on Forton Field Day. In May 1985 work was commenced to extend the hall as it was no longer big enough . The front facade of the hall will remain but the interior will be completely gutted to provide larger and more modern accommodation, including a stage.
